overview: From 2026-02-01 to 2026-03-01, elizaos/eliza had 6 new PRs (5 merged), 25 new issues, and 17 active contributors.

topIssues.title: [Agent] Eliza Character File & Prompt Engineering
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Improve Eliza's character file and prompts based on initial testing feedback.

## Background

Boris (Feb 2): "I've talked to Eliza only a little bit, just to test her out. I think she'll definitely need some edits in her character file, some more prompt engineering. She's a good start so far, but there's definitely stuff we're gonna have to work on. It'll be iterative."

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Review current character file responses
- [ ] Identify areas needing improvement
- [ ] Update character file with better prompts
- [ ] Add message examples (Ben has PRs for this)
- [ ] Test with Sonnet model
- [ ] Iterate based on user feedback

## Technical Notes

Ben mentioned:

* Currently using a different model, switching to Sonnet
* Two PRs coming that add message examples and change model to Sonnet
* "Huge difference in price between Sonnet and \[current model\]"

Boris mentioned Sonnet 5 coming out soon - good timing to test on Eliza if cheaper.

## Priority

**P2 - Iterative improvement**

topIssues.title: EVENT MESSAGE SENT not working
topIssues.author: Srenonno
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

the sendAgentResponseToBus doens't emit event EventType.MESSAGE_SENT when Sending payload to central server API endpoint (/api/messaging/submit).
 
**To Reproduce**

Create a plugin with Message_sent event and it worn't get triggred
**Expected behavior**
the vent need to be emmitted for every message submitted to the central channel

topIssues.title: feat(scenarios): Enhance LLM Judge with multi-level evaluation
topIssues.author: monilpat

topIssues.title: [Infra] Telegram Webhook Registration
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Set up Telegram webhook registration so the bot can catch and route messages to the correct agent instance.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Telegram webhook properly registered
- [ ] Webhook endpoint receiving messages
- [ ] Messages routed to correct agent instance
- [ ] Works with pure webhook approach (no polling)

## Technical Notes

* TG will work on pure webhook but needs it registered to catch for agent
* Odilitime can help with this setup
* Different from Discord - TG uses webhooks natively

## Priority

**P0 - This Week**

topIssues.title: [Infra] Deploy Discord as AWS Service
topIssues.author: borisudovicic
topIssues.body:
## Description

Deploy Discord plugin as a service in our AWS infrastructure that can handle incoming messages and route them to agents.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Discord service deployed to AWS
- [ ] Service can handle incoming Discord events
- [ ] Proper scaling and reliability
- [ ] Integrates with existing Cloud infrastructure

## Technical Notes

* We have a PR for this already
* Odilitime to help get Hanzla up to speed
* Needs to be a proper AWS service, not just local

## Assignee

Hanzla (with help from Odilitime)

## Priority

**P0 - This Week**

topPRs.title: Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
The goal of this PR is to tightly integrate the elizaos cloud plugin, which now can use cloud as a db and storage provider, and encourage users through the CLI to get up and running with elizaos cloud. CLI should auto log them in, provision API key and make sure project is set up.

Please thoroughly review and understand the create -> deploy -> publish and monetize flow, may still need some work

topPRs.title: fix: Add null/undefined checks to prevent Object.entries errors in plugin-bootstrap
topPRs.author: anchapin
topPRs.body:
## Summary Fixes critical runtime errors in `plugin-bootstrap` providers when metadata or values are null/undefined. ## Problem The agent crashes with the error: ``` Object.entries requires that input parameter not be null or undefined ``` This occurs in several providers: 1. **relationshipsProvider**: When `entity.metadata` is null/undefined 2. **actionStateProvider**: When `result.values` or `workingMemory` are not objects 3. **recentMessagesProvider**: Similar issues with null values ## Solution Added proper null/undefined checks before calling `Object.entries()`: ### 1. `src/providers/relationships.ts` - Added null/undefined check in `formatMetadata()` - Returns `'{}'` for null/undefined metadata instead of crashing ### 2. `src/providers/actionState.ts` - Added type check for `result.values` before calling `Object.entries()` - Added type/null check for `workingMemory` before calling `Object.keys()` ## Changes - **packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/relationships.ts**: Guard `formatMetadata()` against null metadata - **packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/actionState.ts**: Add type guards for `result.values` and `workingMemory` ## Testing 1. Started ElizaOS agent 2. Sent messages via web interface (http://localhost:3000) 3. Verified no more `Object.entries` errors 4. Confirmed agent responds properly instead of showing IGNORE action ## Impact - ‚úÖ Prevents agent crashes when entities have null metadata - ‚úÖ Improves stability for action result processing - ‚úÖ Fixes "IGNORE" action issue when agent can't retrieve conversation context - ‚úÖ No breaking changes - only adds safety checks Co-Authored-By: Claude Sonnet 4.5

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR fixes critical `Object.entries` runtime errors in plugin-bootstrap providers that caused agent crashes when metadata or values were null/undefined. However, **the PR contains significantly more changes than described in the title and description**. ## What's Actually in This PR ### 1. Plugin-Bootstrap Fixes (Matches PR Description) - `actionState.ts`: Added type guards before `Object.entries()` on `result.values` and `workingMemory` - `relationships.ts`: Added null check in `formatMetadata()` to prevent crashes ### 2. Major New Feature (Not Mentioned in PR Description) - **Request Context System**: New per-entity settings infrastructure for multi-tenant deployments - Added `packages/core/src/request-context.ts` and `request-context.node.ts` (856+ lines) - Modified `runtime.ts` `getSetting()` to check request context first - Enables different users sharing the same runtime to have different API keys, OAuth tokens, etc. ### 3. Message Service Changes (Not Mentioned in PR Description) - Refactored message creation logic in `message.ts` - Added `MESSAGE_SENT` event emission after sending to central server ### 4. Version Bumps - All packages bumped to `1.7.3-alpha.3` ## Concerns The PR title says "fix: Add null/undefined checks" but this PR includes: - A major architectural feature (request context system) - Message service refactoring - 30 files changed, 1107 insertions, 52 deletions **This should have been split into separate PRs** for better review, testing, and rollback capability. The plugin-bootstrap fixes are straightforward and safe, but bundling them with a major new feature makes it difficult to: - Review each change independently - Test each feature in isolation - Roll back if issues arise with one component ## Technical Review The actual code changes are well-implemented: - Null checks are correctly placed and handle edge cases - Request context system follows AsyncLocalStorage patterns appropriately - Message service changes maintain event emission order The plugin-bootstrap fixes will definitely prevent the `Object.entries` crashes described in the PR.

Confidence Score: 3/5

- This PR contains well-implemented code but has significant scope creep beyond its stated purpose - Score of 3 reflects that while the code quality is good and the plugin-bootstrap fixes are safe, the PR includes undocumented major features (request context system, message service changes) that should have been separate PRs. This makes comprehensive testing difficult and increases risk. The PR description is misleading about the actual scope of changes. - Pay close attention to `packages/core/src/runtime.ts` and `packages/core/src/request-context.ts` as these introduce a new architectural pattern for per-entity settings that affects how settings are resolved throughout the system

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/actionState.ts | Added type guards for `result.values` and `workingMemory` before calling `Object.keys()` to prevent runtime errors when these values are null/undefined | | packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/relationships.ts | Added null/undefined check in `formatMetadata()` to return `'{}'` when metadata is null/undefined instead of crashing on `Object.entries()` | | packages/core/src/runtime.ts | Added request context lookup in `getSetting()` for per-entity settings support - enables multi-tenant deployments with per-user API keys | | packages/server/src/services/message.ts | Refactored message creation to emit MESSAGE_SENT event after successfully sending to central server, improving event lifecycle tracking | | packages/core/src/request-context.ts | New file implementing request context system for per-entity settings in multi-tenant deployments |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User participant MessageService participant Runtime participant Provider participant Database Note over User,Database: Object.entries Error Flow (Before Fix) User->>MessageService: Send message MessageService->>Runtime: Process message Runtime->>Provider: Get context (actionStateProvider) Provider->>Provider: Access result.values (null) Provider->>Provider: Object.entries(null) ‚ùå Provider-->>Runtime: CRASH Note over User,Database: Fixed Flow (After This PR) User->>MessageService: Send message MessageService->>Runtime: Process message Runtime->>Provider: Get context (actionStateProvider) Provider->>Provider: Check if result.values is object alt result.values is null/undefined Provider->>Provider: Skip Object.entries else result.values is valid object Provider->>Provider: Object.entries(result.values) ‚úì end Provider-->>Runtime: Return formatted context Runtime->>Runtime: Generate response Runtime->>Database: Create memory MessageService->>MessageService: Emit MESSAGE_SENT event MessageService-->>User: Response delivered Note over User,Database: Request Context Feature (New) User->>Runtime: getSetting(key) Runtime->>Runtime: Check request context alt Entity-specific setting exists Runtime-->>User: Return entity setting else No entity setting Runtime->>Runtime: Fall back to agent setting Runtime-->>User: Return agent setting end ``` (2/5) Greptile learns from your feedback when you react with thumbs up/down!

topPRs.title: V2.0.0: dynamic execution engine (test if context is going to blown)
topPRs.author: odilitime
topPRs.body:
Redo #6113 for 2.0.0, first pass --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces a validation-aware, schema-driven prompt execution path and applies it across runtimes and message flows. > > - Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state`/`dynamicPromptExecFromState` (TS/Python/Rust) with per-field/checkpoint UUID validation codes, required-field checks, and retry with backoff; supports XML/JSON > - Refactors message handling (should-respond, single-shot, multi-step decision, final summary) to use structured schemas instead of ad-hoc parsing > - Implements streaming support in TS with `ValidationStreamExtractor`, `MarkableExtractor`, and streaming context helpers; emits rich `StreamEvent`s > - Introduces shared types: `SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent(Type)` in Python/Rust/TS type modules > - Adds XML parsing utilities (nested-safe) and normalizes structured responses; basic templating in Rust, Handlebars in TS > - Exposes validation level configuration (0‚Äì3) and model selection; defaults to large text models > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 1e447bbc005cbad715eb819aba27eb35b54aa5b8. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot). ## Summary by CodeRabbit * **New Features** * Added dynamic prompt execution with state injection and schema-driven validation. * Enabled validation-aware streaming with configurable validation levels (0-3). * Introduced built-in retry logic with exponential backoff for improved resilience. * Support for structured output validation across JSON and XML formats. * Per-field and checkpoint-level validation for enhanced data integrity. ‚úèÔ∏è Tip: You can customize this high-level summary in your review settings.

Greptile Summary

Introduces `dynamicPromptExecFromState()` across Python, Rust, and TypeScript runtimes to provide schema-driven prompt execution with context validation via UUID codes. The implementation detects when LLMs truncate output due to limited context windows by injecting validation codes at strategic positions (start/middle/end or per-field). Supports four validation levels (0=trusted to 3=full), exponential backoff retries, and optional validation-aware streaming via `ValidationStreamExtractor`. **Key changes:** - Cross-language API consistency for dynamic prompt execution with state injection - Validation code system to detect context overflow (4 levels: trusted, progressive, checkpoint, full) - Streaming integration with progressive validation and retry support - Schema-based structured output parsing (XML/JSON) with required field validation - Performance metrics tracking per model+schema combination (TypeScript only) - Comprehensive type definitions (`SchemaRow`, `RetryBackoffConfig`, `StreamEvent`) **Critical issues in Python implementation:** - Callable prompt invocation wraps state incorrectly (`{"state": state}` vs direct state access) - Template substitution assumes `state.values` has dynamic attributes accessible via `dir()`, incompatible with protobuf State - XML parsing regex `\w+` won't match validation field names with underscores like `code_text_start` **Minor issues:** - Rust template rendering uses basic string replacement instead of full Handlebars compiler - TypeScript `_smartRetryContext` deletion during retry loop prevents reuse on subsequent attempts - ValidationStreamExtractor abort handling may leave inconsistent state

Confidence Score: 3/5

- Python implementation has runtime errors that will break production usage; TypeScript and Rust implementations are safer but need testing - Score reflects critical logical errors in Python (3 bugs that will cause runtime failures), plus architecture differences across languages. TypeScript implementation is most complete with metrics and full Handlebars support. Python bugs must be fixed before merge to avoid breaking callers. - `packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py` requires immediate fixes for callable invocation, state.values access pattern, and XML regex. Test the Python implementation thoroughly before merging.

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/python/elizaos/runtime.py | Adds `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation codes and retry logic; has critical bugs in callable invocation, state.values access, and XML parsing regex | | packages/rust/src/runtime.rs | Implements `dynamic_prompt_exec_from_state` with validation and retry; template rendering is basic string replacement vs full Handlebars | | packages/typescript/src/runtime.ts | Implements `dynamicPromptExecFromState` with metrics, streaming, and validation; minor issue with `_smartRetryContext` deletion timing | | packages/typescript/src/utils/streaming.ts | Implements validation-aware streaming with multiple extractor types; minor state inconsistency on abort signal |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Runtime participant ValidationExtractor participant LLM participant Parser Client->>Runtime: dynamicPromptExecFromState(state, schema, options) Note over Runtime: Generate validation codes
(UUID snippets) Runtime->>Runtime: Build extended schema
with validation fields Runtime->>Runtime: Inject codes into prompt
(initial, middle, end) Runtime->>Runtime: Compile template with
Handlebars/state values alt Streaming enabled Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: Create extractor
(level, schema, codes) end loop Retry attempts (0 to maxRetries) Runtime->>LLM: Generate text with prompt alt Streaming loop Stream chunks LLM-->>ValidationExtractor: chunk ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Extract field content ValidationExtractor->>ValidationExtractor: Check per-field codes
(level 0-1) ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Stream validated content end else Non-streaming LLM-->>Runtime: Complete response end Runtime->>Runtime: Clean response
(remove tags) Runtime->>Parser: Parse XML/JSON response Parser-->>Runtime: Parsed fields object Runtime->>Runtime: Normalize structured response alt Validation level 0-1 loop For each field with code Runtime->>Runtime: Check start/end codes match end else Validation level 2-3 Runtime->>Runtime: Check checkpoint codes
(one_initial, one_middle, etc) end Runtime->>Runtime: Validate required fields
are present and non-empty alt All validations pass alt Streaming (level 2-3) Runtime->>ValidationExtractor: flush() ValidationExtractor-->>Client: Buffered content end Runtime->>Runtime: Remove validation code fields Runtime->>Runtime: Update success metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return parsed response else Validation fails alt Has retries remaining Runtime->>Runtime: Calculate backoff delay Runtime->>Runtime: Wait for backoff Note over Runtime: Loop continues with retry else No retries left Runtime->>Runtime: Update failure metrics Runtime-->>Client: Return null end end end ```

topPRs.title: feat(core): add request context for per-user entity settings
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Adds `RequestContext` using AsyncLocalStorage to propagate per-request entity settings - Enables runtime methods to access the originating entity context without explicit parameter passing - Includes helper methods: `withEntityContext()`, `getRequestContext()`, `getEntitySettings()` ## Test plan - [x] Unit tests for `RequestContext` class - [x] Integration tests for runtime context propagation ü§ñ Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code) --- > [!NOTE] > **Medium Risk** > Changes `AgentRuntime.getSetting()` resolution to prefer request-scoped entity settings (including `null` as an explicit override), which can affect how secrets/config are sourced in multi-tenant flows. Uses global AsyncLocalStorage state in Node, so regressions would show up as mis-scoped settings across concurrent requests if misused. > > **Overview** > Introduces a new request-scoped `RequestContext` API (`runWithRequestContext`, `getRequestContext`, and a pluggable `IRequestContextManager`) to propagate per-entity settings through async execution. > > Adds a Node.js implementation backed by `AsyncLocalStorage` and initializes it from `index.node.ts`, while exporting the new utilities from both `index.ts` and `index.node.ts`. > > Updates `AgentRuntime.getSetting()` to check `requestCtx.entitySettings` first (treating `undefined` as fallthrough and `null` as an explicit return) and return entity values without `decryptSecret`, with new unit/integration tests covering async propagation, concurrency isolation, and precedence over character settings/secrets. > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit a0e2d2d3a74a829c2edaf7e5f848a5ba1aea788f. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

Greptile Summary

This PR adds `RequestContext` infrastructure to enable per-entity settings in multi-tenant deployments, allowing multiple users to share a single agent runtime while maintaining isolated settings (API keys, OAuth tokens, etc.). **Key Changes:** - New `RequestContext` interface and `runWithRequestContext()` API for propagating per-request entity settings - AsyncLocalStorage-based implementation for Node.js (`request-context.node.ts`) ensuring proper async context isolation - Modified `runtime.getSetting()` to check request context first before falling back to character settings - Comprehensive test coverage (28 tests) covering context isolation, concurrency, priority, and integration with runtime **Design:** - Follows OpenTelemetry ContextManager pattern (consistent with existing `streaming-context.ts`) - NoopContextManager fallback ensures backward compatibility - Entity settings are pre-decrypted, avoiding duplicate decryption - Clear priority chain: entity settings ‚Üí character settings ‚Üí null **Testing:** - Unit tests verify context isolation across 10 concurrent requests - Integration tests confirm proper `getSetting()` behavior and priority - Edge cases covered: null vs undefined, nested contexts, error propagation **Issue Found:** - `package.json` version changed to local development version (`1.0.0-local.1768325621`) - must be reverted before merge

Confidence Score: 4/5

- Safe to merge after reverting package.json version change - High-quality implementation with excellent test coverage and clear design patterns. The only issue is the unintentional version change in package.json which must be fixed. Code follows project conventions, includes comprehensive documentation, and all new tests pass. - `packages/core/package.json` needs version reverted to 1.7.2-alpha.1

Important Files Changed

| Filename | Overview | |----------|----------| | packages/core/package.json | Version changed to local development version (1.0.0-local.1768325621), should be reverted before merge | | packages/core/src/request-context.ts | Well-designed context management pattern following OpenTelemetry style, with comprehensive documentation and type safety | | packages/core/src/runtime.ts | Added request context check to getSetting() with proper fallback chain and clear comments |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant User as User/Entity participant Server as Server/Handler participant RC as RequestContext participant ALS as AsyncLocalStorage participant Runtime as AgentRuntime participant DB as Database User->>Server: Send message/request Note over Server: Fetch entity settings Server->>DB: Query entity settings for userId DB-->>Server: Return settings Map Server->>RC: runWithRequestContext(context, fn) Note over RC: context = {entityId, agentId, entitySettings} RC->>ALS: storage.run(context, fn) Note over ALS: Store context in AsyncLocalStorage ALS->>Runtime: Execute fn() ‚Üí runtime.handleMessage() Runtime->>Runtime: getSetting(key) Runtime->>RC: getRequestContext() RC->>ALS: storage.getStore() ALS-->>RC: Return active context RC-->>Runtime: Return context alt Entity setting exists Runtime-->>Runtime: Return entitySettings.get(key) Note over Runtime: Pre-decrypted, return as-is else Fallback to character settings Runtime-->>Runtime: Check character.settings/secrets Note over Runtime: Apply decryption if needed end Runtime-->>Server: Complete message processing Server-->>User: Send response Note over ALS: Context automatically cleared after fn() completes ```

topPRs.title: docs: core documentation guides
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary - Adds core documentation pages: architecture, core concepts, plugin development, interop, deployment, and API reference. ## Test plan - [ ] Review rendered markdown formatting and links. --- > [!NOTE] > Introduces comprehensive core docs and refines interop contract wording. No runtime or API code changes. > > - Adds `docs/ARCHITECTURE.md`, `docs/CORE_CONCEPTS.md`, `docs/PLUGIN_DEVELOPMENT.md`, `docs/DEPLOYMENT_GUIDE.md`, `docs/API_REFERENCE.md`, and `docs/INTEROP_GUIDE.md` > - Updates `packages/interop/README.md` to describe the plugin interface as a documented contract and relax strict `plugin.json` requirement > > Written by [Cursor Bugbot](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot) for commit 38427d0d3da35f9da04f5bb8505eb61812635a7b. This will update automatically on new commits. Configure [here](https://cursor.com/dashboard?tab=bugbot).

Greptile Overview

### Greptile Summary This PR adds comprehensive core documentation covering architecture, concepts, plugin development, interop, deployment, and API reference. The documentation is well-structured and provides valuable guidance for developers working with ElizaOS. **Strengths:** - Accurate file path references throughout most documentation - Clear explanation of the message processing pipeline and plugin lifecycle - Practical examples for common use cases (deployment patterns, plugin development) - Good coverage of multi-language interop patterns (TypeScript/Rust/Python) **Issues Found:** 1. **Route handler signature error** (PLUGIN_DEVELOPMENT.md): Missing required `runtime` parameter in route handler example 2. **Non-existent file reference** (INTEROP_GUIDE.md): References `plugin.schema.json` which doesn't exist in the repository 3. **Markdown formatting issue** (CORE_CONCEPTS.md): Malformed bold syntax with extra asterisks in ProviderResult description The documentation is mostly accurate and comprehensive, with only minor syntax/reference issues that should be corrected before merge. ### Confidence Score: 4/5 - This PR is safe to merge after addressing the code example syntax error - Score of 4 reflects high-quality documentation with thorough verification against the codebase. One syntax error (missing parameter) should be fixed, and one file reference issue noted. No code changes means no runtime risk. The markdown formatting issue is cosmetic but should be corrected for professional presentation. - docs/PLUGIN_DEVELOPMENT.md requires correction of the route handler example; docs/INTEROP_GUIDE.md has a reference to a non-existent file that should be addressed

Important Files Changed

File Analysis | Filename | Score | Overview | |----------|-------|----------| | docs/ARCHITECTURE.md | 5/5 | Excellent high-level architecture overview with accurate repository mapping, core abstractions, and detailed end-to-end data flow. All file paths reference existing files. | | docs/CORE_CONCEPTS.md | 4/5 | Clear explanation of core concepts including runtime, state, providers, models, actions, and evaluators. Minor markdown formatting issue with extra asterisks in bullet points (lines 59-61). | | docs/INTEROP_GUIDE.md | 3/5 | Documents cross-language interop via WASM, FFI, and IPC. References non-existent plugin.schema.json file. Otherwise accurate with correct file paths for existing TypeScript, Rust, and Python interop code. | | docs/PLUGIN_DEVELOPMENT.md | 3/5 | Comprehensive plugin development guide with examples for actions, providers, services, models, routes, and events. Route handler example missing required runtime parameter (line 129). |

Sequence Diagram

```mermaid sequenceDiagram participant Client participant Runtime as AgentRuntime participant MsgSvc as MessageService participant Providers participant LLM as Model participant Actions participant DB as DatabaseAdapter participant Evaluators Client->>Runtime: handleMessage(message) Runtime->>DB: createMemory(message) DB-->>Runtime: message persisted Runtime->>Runtime: queueEmbeddingGeneration() Runtime->>MsgSvc: handleMessage(runtime, message, callback) MsgSvc->>Runtime: composeState(message) Runtime->>Providers: get(runtime, message, state) Providers-->>Runtime: ProviderResult (text, values, data) Runtime-->>MsgSvc: State (cached) MsgSvc->>MsgSvc: shouldRespond? alt Should Respond MsgSvc->>LLM: useModel(TEXT_LARGE, prompt) LLM-->>MsgSvc: XML response (thought, actions, text) opt Actions Requested MsgSvc->>Runtime: processActions(message, responses, state) Runtime->>Actions: handler(runtime, message, state, options) Actions-->>Runtime: ActionResult Runtime->>DB: createMemory(actionResult) end MsgSvc->>Client: callback(responseContent) MsgSvc->>DB: createMemory(response) MsgSvc->>Runtime: evaluate(message, state, responses) Runtime->>Evaluators: handler(runtime, message, state) Evaluators-->>Runtime: evaluation results end ```

topContributors.summary: 0xbbjoker: Focused on maintenance and stability by addressing technical debt through targeted bugfix work. They contributed a single commit that modified three files, resulting in a balanced set of nine additions and eight deletions. This activity reflects a precise approach to resolving existing issues within the codebase. Their primary focus for the month was dedicated entirely to bugfix efforts across various file types.
